THE original draft of the present catalogue was meant to be included in Bz'blz'ograplcz'a Paracelsz'ca, Part II., printed in 1885. It was at first a meagre list, devoid of cross references, a bare counterpart of Mook's catalogue and quite useless apart from it. It has been extended, and I hope improved, by constant criticism and revision, until it has got into its present shape. It is not the final form of a catalogue of the kind, but it may serve till it

is superseded by one better and completer.

JOHN FERGUSON.

THE UNIVERSITY, GLASGOW‚ February roth, 1893.
